item.title: Best of Austin Small-Group Driving Tour with Local Guide
item.description: Get a comprehensive overview of Austin on this sightseeing tour. See famous landmarks along with hidden gems, real neighborhoods, and food trucks. Learn about Austin's history and culture with commentary from your guide and hear fun facts about the city that even the locals don't know. Plus, choose a morning or afternoon departure to easily fit this tour into your schedule.

image.alt: Best of Austin Small-Group Driving Tour with Local Guide

item.title: Austin Biker Gang E-Bike Tour
item.description: Come join this Austin e-bike biker gang to see the sights and feels the vibes of the crown jewel of Hill County. The e-bikes are fun, easy to ride and best with friends to get around this amazing city. Ride past Austin and Hill County icons including The Driskill (a historic and haunted hotel), Austin City Limits, Town Lake, and much more. Enjoy a dynamic experience in a vibrant city where every ride is different.

image.alt: Austin Biker Gang E-Bike Tour

item.title: Austin and Hill Country Sightseeing Tour
item.description: Want to see the best of Austin and the Hill County in the comfort of an air-conditioned Mercedes-Benz sprinter van with a local guide? Look no further! In 90 minutes, this signature tour covers 30 miles and 50+ points of interest, including the Texas Capitol and East Austin’s Six Square District, to give you a taste of the city’s rich culture and history. For even more exploration (with stops), check out the 2.5-hour version of this tour. Route subject to changes or substitutions.

image.alt: Austin and Hill Country Sightseeing Tour

item.title: From Austin: Hill Country BBQ & Wine Shuttle
item.description: Leave the busy city and enjoy a half-day experience filled with barbecue and wine by booking this Texas Hill Country Barbecue and Wine Shuttle Service from Austin. This shuttle service can be booked for small groups or private groups of up to 10 people. Your driver takes you to the outskirts of Austin to visit three different venues, including two popular wineries and Salt Lick BBQ outpost.

image.alt: From Austin: Hill Country BBQ & Wine Shuttle

item.title: Haunted Austin Walking History Tour
item.description: Hear the historical tales of murder and mayhem that helped make Austin weird on this haunted history tour of Texas's capital city. Join an acclaimed storyteller and a small group for a walking tour through Austin's supernatural nooks and creepy crannies, including a tour of the famous Driskill Hotel.

image.alt: Haunted Austin Walking History Tour

item.title: Austin Walking Food Tour With Secret Food Tours
item.description: Ideal for foodies and hungry visitors, this Downtown Austin Walking Food Tour lets you explore the city’s central and historic area and sample numerous foods—from barbecue brisket to Austin-style breakfast tacos and even an Italian cannoli. Along the way, discover some of the city’s popular sights and attractions as you stroll the streets with a guide who’s passionate about Austin and shares stories along the route.

image.alt: Austin Walking Food Tour With Secret Food Tours

item.title: Double Decker Austin Single Loop Sightseeing Tour
item.description: Save time looking up bus schedules and opt for this hassle-free Austin sightseeing bus tour instead. Travel on a loop around the city that passes by top landmarks in Austin’s downtown area. Along the way, listen to commentary from a guide, get great photos from the top deck, or sit in the climate-controlled lower deck. Highlights include 6th Street, The Museum of the Weird, The Driskill hotel, Texas State Capitol, and the Texas Governor’s Mansion.

image.alt: Double Decker Austin Single Loop Sightseeing Tour

item.title: Austin Electric Bike Tour: Let it Ride
item.description: If you want to see more of Austin in less time—without getting jammed into a tour bus—book this e-bike tour perfect for seeing the sights, while enjoying Austin's fantastic weather. Hop on your pedal-assist e-bike, and follow your guide to Austin's famous murals, city landmarks, and University of Texas buildings. Along the way, take in views of the downtown skyline, and visit the Texas State Capitol building.

image.alt: Austin Electric Bike Tour: Let it Ride

item.title: Austin in a Nutshell Bike Tour with a Local Guide
item.description: If you want to see Austin by bike but don’t know the routes to take to see most of the city’s highlights in just a few hours, book this Austin Bike Tour. This tour explores on regular, hybrid bikes and covers about 10 miles (16.1 kilometers) of ground throughout Austin. Bike through Zilker Park, around Lady Bird Lake, across Congress Avenue Bridge, and by attractions such as the Texas State Capitol building.

image.alt: Austin in a Nutshell Bike Tour with a Local Guide

item.title: Austin Live Music Crawl
item.description: Experience Austin's live music scene on a tour led by a guide. Visit as many as three iconic clubs and up-and-coming venues and enjoy hearing live music with a group of fun fellow travelers. Don't get caught listening to cover bands, listen to authentic music in one of the world's music capitals.

image.alt: Austin Live Music Crawl

item.title: Austin Guided Outdoor Climbing Experience
item.description: If you've always wanted to try rock climbing, look no further than this guided, beginner-friendly climbing experience in Austin. Let your guide show you the ropes (no pun intended), as you suit up with the proper gear, learn about the safety requirements, and cover skills needed to succeed on your climb. After learning the basics, spend the rest of the day practicing your skills with your fellow climbers, to get the hang of the sport.

image.alt: Austin Guided Outdoor Climbing Experience

item.title: Austin Small Group Morning Walk
item.description: Get to know Austin on a leisurely morning walk with a nationally acclaimed storyteller as your guide. Learn little-known stories about the city, get inside tips on the best coffee shops, restaurants, and live music venues, and explore the city like a local. This tour helps you avoid tourist traps to make the most of your visit to Austin. Great for kids and adults alike, learn about the city in a fun, low-key way.

image.alt: Austin Small Group Morning Walk

item.title: Austin Murder Walk
item.description: In 1885, America’s first serial killer stalked the streets and alleyways of the city of Austin. He came to be known as the “Midnight Assassin,” but his identity remains a mystery. On this guided evening walking tour, explore historic Austin including West 6th Street, Guy Town, and the Warehouse District, plus stop for a drink at the Driskill Hotel, as you learn about his crimes.

image.alt: Austin Murder Walk

item.title: Austin and Hill Country Panoramic Sightseeing Tour
item.description: Get to know Austin on this guided bus tour. Hear about the history of the Texas capital aboard a roomy Mercedes-Benz sprinter van. This open-air vehicle comes equipped with headsets that offer both English and Spanish language options. See local hangouts, hip and historic neighborhoods, and Central Texas Hill Country. Along the way, stop to take photos at locations such as the Driskill Hotel, Barton Springs, and the Austin Public Library. Route subject to changes or substitutions.

image.alt: Austin and Hill Country Panoramic Sightseeing Tour

item.title: Austin Good Vibes E-Bike Tours
item.description: Cover more ground during this Austin Small-Group E-Bike Tour than if you booked a walking tour of the city. This bike tour provides you with an e-bike and helmet so you can explore Austin’s most popular attractions and sights as you pass by them with a guide leading the way. Plus, your guide tells you about the city and ideas that go far beyond just the normal tourist path.

image.alt: Austin Good Vibes E-Bike Tours

item.title: Austin Sightseeing and Capitol Segway Tour
item.description: Go sightseeing in Austin by Segway on a 1.5-hour tour that allows you to cover more ground than other types of tours. Get an overview of downtown Austin and capture numerous photo ops as you pass by the Texas State Capitol Building, Congress Avenue, Warehouse Entertainment District, Lady Bird Lake, the historic Driskill Hotel, and other landmarks.

image.alt: Austin Sightseeing and Capitol Segway Tour

item.title: Austin's Gem Bike Tour
item.description: Discover the highlights of Austin along with several local breweries during this half-day beer tasting and bike tour. Pedal past landmarks including the Texas State Cemetery and the Moonlight Towers and stop for sudsy refreshments at three breweries. Your guide shares commentary about the city and breweries on a moderate level bike tour that is suitable for most people with biking experience. Bike gear and beers are included.

image.alt: Austin's Gem Bike Tour

item.title: Small-Group Public BYOB Sunset Boat Tour on Lake Travis
item.description: It can be tricky to choose the best spot to watch an Austin sunset without doing lots of research, but this tour makes the decision for you and showcases magnificent sunset views from the water. Sail out along the clear waters of Lake Travis on a small-group boat tour and enjoy captain commentary about local sights and Austin’s history.

image.alt: Small-Group Public BYOB Sunset Boat Tour on Lake Travis

item.title: Half-Day Hill Country Wine Shuttle From Austin
item.description: Approximately 45 minutes southwest of Austin lies the Driftwood/Wimberley area of the Texas Hill County. Here, you'll find rustic charm, winding roads, rolling hills, and amazing wine. You'll travel in a Mercedes Sprinter van and friendly local guide with a maximum of 10 people. Sample the wines and soak in the ambiance at three award-winning wineries (tasting fee not included.) Tour is 4.5 hours, leaving at 1:30, returning at 6 pm.

image.alt: Half-Day Hill Country Wine Shuttle From Austin

item.title: Austin Mural Selfie Tour by Pedicab
item.description: Ride through Austin via a pedicab and stop along the way to snap social media-worthy selfies. Visit the city’s most popular and photographed street art, such as the “I love you so much,” “Greetings from Austin” postcard, and the “Willie for President” murals. Since this is a private tour, you are able to tailor it for your group.

image.alt: Austin Mural Selfie Tour by Pedicab

item.title: Congress Avenue Bat Bridge Kayak Tour in Austin
item.description: Watch more than a million bats fly out of the Congress Avenue Bridge on an evening kayak tour of Austin that’s timed to catch the spectacular natural show. Observing the Congress Avenue Bridge bats from a kayak means you don’t have to find a spot among the crowds on the riverbank, giving you a front-row seat as the Mexican free-tailed bats take to the sky.

image.alt: Congress Avenue Bat Bridge Kayak Tour in Austin

item.title: Downtown Austin Live Music Pub Crawl
item.description: Discover Austin’s pub scene with the help of a guide who’ll help you see the city through the eyes of a local on this small-group walking tour. Learn more about Austin’s vibrant music culture and storied past while you experience different watering holes and listen to local bands perform. Don’t worry about exploring the city by night thanks to your group and tour guide.

image.alt: Downtown Austin Live Music Pub Crawl

item.title: The Brunch Bus: Food Tour with a Live Band on Board the Bus!
item.description: Get a taste of Austin on a brunch tour to three local establishments. Traveling on a fun with live music performed by local musicians, travel to each location for your included breakfast tasting and beverage. Bring your appetite and expect to sample local specialties like breakfast tacos, Czech kolaches, and chicken and waffles.

image.alt: The Brunch Bus: Food Tour with a Live Band on Board the Bus!

item.title: Austin Famous Ghost and Bat Segway Tour
item.description: Discover another side of Austin on a 2.5-hour Segway tour that features bats and ghosts. Offered from March to October, this nighttime ride through downtown Austin visits haunted hotels and buildings, famous landmarks, and the world’s largest urban bat colony. See the Texas State Capitol Building, Lady Bird Lake, Austin Convention Center, the 6th Street Entertainment district, Moonlight Towers, and more

image.alt: Austin Famous Ghost and Bat Segway Tour
